intro: Isotrema mollissimum, commonly known as the silky isotrema, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
